title: Chief Minister Stalin wanted to challenge the Waqf (Amendments) Act in SC: MP Wilson
content: He says amendments to the Waqf Act brought about in 1995 were sufficient, and the BJP‚Äôs decision to form a committee and its actions are ‚Äúoppressive‚Äù

title: ED arrests MD of Biswal Tradelink¬†in fake bank guarantee case

content: Former CJI says former judges can bring a lot to the table in places like tribunals; adds that some exceptional individuals have occupied legislative offices

title: Access to safe, well-maintained roads a part of right to life: Supreme Court judgment
content: ‚ÄòIt is the responsibility of the State to develop and maintain the roads directly under its control,‚Äô the Court noted

title: Helicopter operators miffed with unofficial ban on flying in Uttarakhand
content: The Business Aircraft Operators Association has written to the Uttarakhand Civil Aviation Development Authority, asserting that the DGCA is the ‚Äòsole regulatory authority‚Äô empowered to assess and direct aviation safety measures in the country

title: Congress Dalit leaders meet at Parameshwara‚Äôs residence, discuss internal quota
content: Ministers and MLAs belonging to the Scheduled Castes (SC) community of the Congress held a meeting at the residence of Home Minister G. Parameshwara in the city on Saturday, amid a demand for implementing the internal quota among SC groups

title: Photos recovered from an encounter site in 2024 helped identify Pahalgam terrorists¬†¬†
content: Security personnel started their search after the terrorists‚Äô photos were matched with the accounts of eyewitnesses present at the Baisaran meadow on April 22

title: Chennai woman behind hoax bomb threat emails across India arrested by RGIA police
content: The accused Rene Joshilda was brought to Hyderabad on July 20 on a transit warrant in connection with two cases registered against her by the RGIA police earlier this year.

title: Post offices across the country to accept digital payments soon
content: The Department of Posts is upgrading its IT systems for UPI integration with Speed Post; it is taking steps to get enough space for mail bags on flights

title: As govt. gears up to revive Buddhist history in Rajaghatta near Bengaluru, villagers stand divided¬†
content: Rajaghatta, which was an ancient settlement of Buddhists probably around the fourth and fifth centuries, is getting ready once again for excavation

title: Chhattisgarh BJP deletes controversial post on the arrest of Kerala nuns following backlash
content: The cartoon, depicting Congress leaders bowing to nuns, and as well-wishers of those indulging in human trafficking and religious conversions, was posted and deleted in quick succession

title: BJP may contest all 40 seats in Assam‚Äôs Bodoland Council
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said his party will not go for a tie-up with its current regional ally, the United People‚Äôs Party Liberal, which heads the Council

title: Technology is powerful but cannot replicate human touch in justice delivery or legal aid: Justice Surya Kant
content: He was speaking on bridging the ‚Äòdigital gap‚Äô and ‚Äòreimagining legal aid in the digital age for inclusive justice in India‚Äô at the Justice RC Lahoti Memorial Lecture

title: Trump's Tariffs Leave A Lot Of Losers. But Even Winners Will Pay A Price
content: President Donald Trump's tariff onslaught this week left a lot of losers - from small, poor countries like Laos and Algeria to wealthy US trading partners like Canada and Switzerland.

title: US Court Upholds Order Blocking Indiscriminate Targeting By Immigration Patrols In California
content: A US appeals court has upheld an order blocking immigration agents from carrying out patrols in California that led to indiscriminate detentions without reasonable grounds to suspect people of being undocumented.

title: Popular Tamil Actor Madhan Bob Dead
content: Popular Tamil film actor Madhan Bob, who entertained film fans through his characteristic laughter and amusing expressions, is no more.

title: Ukraine Uncovers Major Drone Procurement Corruption Scheme
content: Ukraine's anti-corruption bodies said on Saturday they had uncovered a major graft scheme that procured military drones and signal jamming systems at inflated prices, two days after the agencies' independence was restored following major protests.

title: Kuki Students Ask Manipur Governor To Open State Civil Service Exam Centre In Churachandpur
content: State civil service aspirants in Manipur's Churachandpur district have requested Governor AK Bhalla to hold the Manipur Public Service Commission (MPSC) mains exam in the southern hill district too.

title: Slapped On Flight, He Went Missing, Then Found At Railway Station
content: The man who was slapped by a fellow passenger after suffering a panic attack mid-flight and then went missing has been found at a railway station in Assam's Barpeta, nearly 800 km from Kolkata, where the flight had landed.

title: 'US Tariffs Will Hurt Andhra Aqua Farmers, We Will Help Them': Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh is exploring options to ensure the fallout of the US imposing 25 per cent tariffs on India does not affect the state's aqua farmers, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu said on Saturday.

title: Caught Without Ticket, Mumbai Train Passenger Goes On Vandalism Spree
content: One of the four passengers deboarded from a suburban train in Mumbai turned violent, breaking property inside the ticket checker's office and attacking railway staff.

title: SpaceX Delivers 4 Astronauts To International Space Station Just 15 Hours After Launch
content: SpaceX delivered a fresh crew to the International Space Station on Saturday, making the trip in a quick 15 hours.

title: Honeymoon Murder Case: Custody Of 2 Accused Extended For 14 Days
content: A Meghalaya court has extended the judicial custody of Sonam Raghuvanshi and Raj Kushwaha, the prime accused in the murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi, by another 14 days, officials said on Saturday.

title: Woman, Boyfriend Arrested For Killing Husband, Dumping Body In Drain In Delhi: Cops
content: Delhi Police has arrested a woman and her boyfriend for allegedly plotting and executing the murder of her husband and dumping his body in a drain in Haryana's Sonipat, an official said on Saturday.

title: Odisha Police Say No One Else Involved In Puri Teen's Death
content: Hours after the death of the 15-year-old girl from Puri district at AIIMS, Delhi, Odisha Police on Saturday claimed that no other person was involved in the incident.

title: Man Who Slapped Passenger Can Never Fly With Us Again: IndiGo
content: IndiGo has banned an individual from all its flights after a video showed him slapping a co-traveller on board a Mumbai-Kolkata flight.

title: Man Kills Painter In Delhi, Suspected Him Of Having Affair With Wife: Cops
content: A 47-year-old man allegedly killed a painter in Delhi, suspecting him of having an affair with his wife and not returning money he had lent him, an official said on Saturday.

title: "Has His Reasons": Shashi Tharoor On Rahul Gandhi's "Dead Economy" Remark
content: Shashi Tharoor on Saturday refused to comment on Rahul Gandhi's endorsing US President Donald Trump's 'dead economy' remark about India and said the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha may have had his "own reasons" for saying so.

title: On Camera, Trinamool Leader On Bike Hacked To Death With Sickle In Bengal
content: A Trinamool Congress panchayat-level leader was killed in West Bengal's Hooghly district on Wednesday and CCTV footage has now emerged showing that he was brutally hacked to death.

title: In Tejashwi Yadav Row, Poll Body Sources Hint At Fake Voter ID
content: Tejashwi Yadav, a voter in Patna and a former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister, connected his phone to a large screen at a press conference and tried to search his own EPIC number which threw up the result "no records found".

title: Protesters In Bangkok Demand Resignation Of Court-Suspended Prime Minister
content: Protesters rallied Saturday in the Thai capital to demand the resignation of court-suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.

title: Bulldozer Falls 300 Metres Into Gorge In Rain-Battered Shimla, Driver Dead
content: A bulldozer met with an accident while it was opening a road in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, sending it tumbling down the mountain-side.

title: Mani Shankar Aiyar Fires 'Op Sindoor' Broadside At Shashi Tharoor
content: Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar has taken a swipe at party MP Shashi Tharoor's foreign visits as part of India's global outreach to inform other nations of Pakistan's role behind the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: The Naxals are receding. Now what?
content: As people associated with left-wing extremism are being killed or are surrendering and the forested areas under their control come into the government‚Äôs fold, the civilian administration is recalibrating its approach to deliver services in the face of few roads, low Internet connectivity and scattered electricity supply, finds¬†Shubhomoy Sikdar

title: Former Jharkhand CM Shibu Soren on ventilator support: sources
content: Shibu Soren has been admitted to the Sri Ganga Ram Hospital in the national capital for over a month due to a kidney-related issue

title: KCR‚Äôs corruption exposed in Kaleshwaram, says Mahesh Goud
content: The failure of Kaleshwaram project isn‚Äôt just inefficiency but criminal negligence, says TPCC president

content: 14th Graduation Day of Sree Vidyanikethan Engineering College held on university campus with Former Union Minister Praful Patel as chief guest

title: CM, others mourn loss of M.K. Sanoo
content: Prof. Sanoo was an excellent teacher, orator, public activist, social worker, writer, and literary critic and in step with the State‚Äôs progressive achievement, says Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Transport Department prepares Plan B as KSRTC strike looms
content: Officials discussed the possibility of deploying private buses in case the strike severely affects public transportation, especially in urban and semi-urban areas

title: Kerala Film Policy Conclave: Minimum wages, basic facilities on sets, effective ICC among issues raised on film conclave
content: One of the major issues raised regarding women‚Äôs safety on sets was the need for improving the functioning of the internal complaints committee with clear definitions of workplace

title: Bail for nuns brings in a rush of relief for Kerala

Political bonhomie was short-lived, with Congress and CPI(M) criticising BJP Kerala president Rajeev Chandrasekhar‚Äôs comments

content: At a Congress event in Delhi, he told the gathering that Mr. Jaitley had told him ‚Äòif you continue down this path, opposing us on farm laws, we will have to act against you‚Äô

content: Officials from the Irrigation, Revenue, and Mines Departments conduct coordinated raids in Rajanagaram mandal following complaints

content: EC to issue new EPIC cards to electors after SIR; it opens special camps to help people file objections, and shares list of excluded names with political parties

title: Tiruchi Corporation fixes user charges at Panjapur bus terminus
content: Two companies have won the bid for operation and maintenance of bus terminus for three years; the charge is ‚Çπ64 lakh and to be raised by 15% every subsequent year

content: However, the State Load Despatch Centre is confident of meeting the demand through various power arrangements

content: Though earlier reports said three miscreants had set her ablaze, police say probe had made it clear that no other person was involved

content: Vowing to develop Amaravati into a global city and Andhra Pradesh as the No. 1 State in India by 2047, the Chief Minister asserts that the P4 initiative is aimed at ushering in an equitable society; he also exhorts people to be vigilant of criminals foraying into politics

title: Residents of Uppiliyapuram demand revival of Maradi lake
content: Spread over 80 acres, Maradi Lake is particularly significant for local irrigation and domestic use in panchayats such as Kottapalayam, Maradi, Okkarai, and parts of Uppiliyapuram block

title: At National Conference for DNTs, calls grow to set up permanent National Commission
content: Bharatiya Janata Party OBC Morcha chief K. Laxman met with community leaders from all over the country; he was presented with a consolidated list of demands from the community leaders of various DNT communities

title: Skill-based education need of the hour: Prof. Thimmana Gowda
content: Former Vice Chancellor of Bengalore University Prof. B. Thimmana Gowda has said that skill-based education had become need of the hour for the present day students and emphasised the need to provide professional and skill-oriented education.

title: 12 labourers injured as landslip hits hydropower project site in Uttarakhand‚Äôs Chamoli
content: Personnel from the State Disaster Response Force, police, and the Health Department have rushed to the project site

title: Auto fare hike: Commuters want crackdown on auto drivers not using meters
content: Recently, the Transport Department has issued a directive instructing all autorickshaws operating within Bengaluru to re-calibrate their meters to reflect the updated rates by October 31

content: At a preparatory meeting, TTD CV&SO Murali Krishna stresses use of advanced surveillance, strategic bandobust, and streamlined pilgrim arrangements for the nine-day festival beginning September 24

content: Former MP for Hassan Prajwal Revanna, who was convicted of rape, broke down in court and pleaded for leniency, when judge Santosh Gajanan Bhat pronounced that the convict had been sentenced to ‚Äúimprisonment for life which shall mean remainder of natural life‚Äù

title: Odisha, Chhattisgarh express willingness to resolve Mahanadi water dispute ‚Äòamicably‚Äô
content: The Mahanadi Water Disputes Tribunal (MWDT) chaired by a retired Supreme Court judge directs both States to apprise it about the progress of the settlement talks between two States on September 6

title: For Nipah prevention, learning to live safely with bats is the way forward, say experts
content: Experts seek to explore airborne transmission risks and advocate for behaviour modification. As bats have a vital role in the environment, it is better to alter human behaviour to have minimal human-bat interactions than trying to remove them from their habitat, say experts.

title: Reports: C's minority owner buys Sun for $325M
content: A group led by Celtics minority owner Steve Pagliuca has reached a deal to buy the WNBA's Connecticut Sun for a record $325 million and plans to move the team to Boston, according to multiple reports.

title: Luka, Lakers reach 3-year, $165M extension
content: The new deal keeps Luka Doncic out of free agency next summer, eliminating his 2026-27 player option in place of a three-year, $165 million maximum contract extension.

title: 'Useless' Hamilton suggests Ferrari driver change
content: A despondent Lewis Hamilton labelled himself "absolutely useless" after qualifying 12th for the Hungarian Grand Prix and said Ferrari "probably need to change driver."

title: Red Sox's Houck to undergo Tommy John surgery
content: Tanner Houck's attempt to come back this season is over, as manager Alex Cora said the Red Sox right-hander will undergo Tommy John surgery.

title: Chargers' Perryman arrested on weapons charge
content: Chargers linebacker Denzel Perryman has been arrested on a felony weapons charge, according to public records.

title: Chiefs' Rice staying in shape amid potential ban
content: With the Chiefs past the midway point of training camp, receiver Rashee Rice said he hasn't been told by the NFL whether he'll be suspended at some point during the 2025 season.

title: Sources: Broncos, DL Allen reach $102M deal
content: The Broncos are signing All-Pro defensive lineman Zach Allen to a four-year, $102 million deal that includes $69.5 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

content: There was a lot of action across baseball ahead of Thursday's trade deadline. How did the moves impact each club's standing?

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: Risers and fallers: Fiebich trending up, Griner struggling
content: Leonie Fiebich has made the most of her increased opportunity on the Liberty, while Brittney Griner continues to have a down season.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Struck in ‚ÄòRudra roop‚Äô: PM dedicates Op Sindoor success to Shiva; warns Pak with UP-made missiles
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his Varanasi visit, dedicated Operation Sindoor's success to Lord Vishwanath, highlighting India's firm stance against terrorism. He criticized opposition parties for questioning the operation's timing and mourning the destruction of terrorist bases in Pakistan. Modi emphasized India's growing defense capabilities, noting that missiles made in Uttar Pradesh will deter future Pakistani misadventures.

title: After quiet series a loud finish for Yashasvi Jaiswal at The Oval with 'Rohit bhai' watching on
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal thoroughly enjoyed reaching three figures and would have certainly meant the world to him because it came in front of his "Rohit bhai". It wasn't a typical Jaiswal hundred where he exercised control and dominated the opposition but looked very determined to get a big one in what had been a quiet series by his lofty standards, and against an opposition he has had a lot of success against.

title: Amid Trump tariff threat, PM pledges to protect farmers, MSMEs & youth
content: Prime Minister Modi, addressing his constituency, emphasized prioritizing farmers' welfare, small industries, and youth employment amid global economic instability. He urged citizens to embrace 'swadeshi' products and support local businesses, highlighting India's economic resilience and commitment to its interests. Modi also transferred Rs 20,500 crore to farmers under the PM-KISAN scheme, reaffirming his government's dedication to agriculture.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125m job offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: 'Only mistake I made ...': What Revanna said before he got life sentence in rape case
content: Suspended JD(S) leader Prajwal Revanna was on Saturday sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a 47-year-old woman. The court fined him Rs 10 lakh. Revanna, denying guilt, claimed political conspiracy. He cited his rapid rise in politics as his ‚Äúonly mistake‚Äù. Revanna was arrested in May 2024 after returning from Germany.

title: 'Can tackle US subs': Russia shrugs off Trump threat; nuclear drama deepens
content: Amidst rising tensions, Russia claims its nuclear submarine presence surpasses that of the US, dismissing Trump's submarine redeployment order as anticipated and already under Russian surveillance. A Duma member asserts that the US submarines are within Russia's control, downplaying the need for a response. Meanwhile, a Russian foreign policy expert suggests Trump's statement is more for show than a strategic military move, urging calm.

title: Jadeja makes history: Breaks Sobers‚Äô 59-yr-old record, surpasses Kohli & Gavaskar
content: Ravindra Jadeja etched his name in cricket history during the fifth Test against England, becoming the first batter to score six 50-plus scores in a single series in England while batting at No.6 or lower. Surpassing Garry Sobers, he also became the first Indian to achieve this feat in England.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‚ÄòI think we have to accomplish more‚Ä¶‚Äô
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.

title: ‚ÄòEPIC‚Äô trouble for Tejashwi? ECI finds mismatch in his voter ID; begins probe
content: Tejashwi Yadav, an RJD leader, claimed his name was missing from Bihar's voter list, alleging a conspiracy. However, the Election Commission of India (ECI) refuted this, stating his name exists with EPIC number RAB0456228, used since 2015. The ECI is investigating a second EPIC number Yadav presented, RAB2916120, which appears non-existent in their records, raising forgery concerns.

title: WWE SummerSlam 2025 Day 1 preview: Full match line-up revealed; start timings, how to watch and more
content: WWE Summer Slam is coming to New Jersey for two days. The event will be held at MetLife Stadium. John Cena and Cody Rhodes will have a WrestleMania rematch. Roman Reigns will fight Jey Uso. Cardi B will appear on Day 1. The event will also pay tribute to Hulk Hogan. SummerSlam will be live-streamed on Netflix.

title: 'Avoid deserted areas': 2 more attacks on Indians in Dublin; embassy issues advisory
content: The Indian embassy in Dublin has issued a warning to its citizens in Ireland following a surge in violent attacks. Recent incidents include stabbings and beatings, leaving victims with serious injuries. Protests have erupted in Dublin, demanding an end to racism and justice for the affected Indian nationals, raising concerns about safety and prompting some to reconsider their residency.

title: LinkedIn cofounder, Silicon Valley's biggest democrat supporter says: There's a problem with Blue states and‚Ä¶
content: Reid Hoffman admits that the Democratic Party alienated Silicon Valley. This drove tech leaders towards Donald Trump. He says attacks on cryptocurrency and Big Tech companies caused this shift. Hoffman points to California's regulations as a problem. He notes companies like Aurora Innovation tested in Texas due to better rules. He urges Democrats to adopt business-friendly policies.

title: 'Learnt a lot from Rohit bhai, Virat bhai': Jaiswal credits seniors after gritty Oval ton
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's brilliant century powered India to a commanding position on Day 3 of the Oval Test. His 118, along with crucial contributions from Akash Deep and Ravindra Jadeja, helped India set England a daunting target of 374. Jaiswal expressed confidence in India's chances, highlighting the spicy wicket and the team's intent to fight.

title: 'We weren‚Äôt up to the mark': Dhoni keeps retirement talk at bay, eyes CSK reboot
content: Mahendra Singh Dhoni addressed Chennai Super Kings' disappointing IPL season, acknowledging the need for a squad overhaul. Despite speculation about his retirement, Dhoni emphasised the importance of addressing the team's weaknesses and starting afresh next season. He highlighted the significance of consistent performance and learning from past mistakes to rebuild CSK's competitiveness.

title: ‚ÄòHe‚Äôs not media puppet‚Äô: Michelle Obama‚Äôs take on Stephen A. Smith; sparks heated debate among fans
content: Michelle Obama's recent comparison of ESPN's Stephen A. Smith to reality television drama has ignited a firestorm of debate among fans. Obama suggested that sports analysis, like 'The Real Housewives of Atlanta,' is filled with unnecessary drama, even joking that Smith would fit right in.

title: Hailee Steinfeld's latest workout photos break the internet
content: While Josh Allen focuses on football, Hailee Steinfeld prioritizes her well-being through fitness and mindfulness. She emphasizes the importance of workouts for mental clarity and emotional resilience, supported by her father, Pete Steinfeld, a personal trainer. Hailee embraces balance, letting go of past body image struggles and finding joy in her wellness journey, setting an example of inner strength.

title: ‚ÄòHe wants her to feel safe‚Äô: Travis Kelce prioritizing Taylor Swift‚Äôs privacy
content: Travis Kelce recently shared rare photos with Taylor Swift on social media, a move reportedly discussed with the pop star beforehand. Sources reveal Kelce prioritized Swift's comfort and privacy, ensuring she approved of the images before posting. While Kelce gears up for the NFL season and Swift remains out of the public eye, their relationship nears the two-year mark.

title: Gabrielle Union on menopause: 'It makes it hard' ‚Äî motherhood now more emotional, exhausting
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: Palestine statehood: What's keeping the dream a dream?
content: France, the UK, and Canada's support for a Palestinian state highlights growing international frustration with Israel, particularly regarding Gaza. Despite this symbolic backing and increasing isolation for Israel, a viable Palestinian state faces significant obstacles. These include a lack of unified leadership, Israeli settlement expansion, and Prime Minister Netanyahu's staunch opposition, making the prospect of statehood more distant than ever.

title: Can England make history? Bazball faces 123-year challenge in Oval Test chase
content: Team India has set a formidable 374-run target for England in the fifth Test at The Oval, fueled by Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and crucial fifties from Akash Deep, Ravindra Jadeja, and Washington Sundar. England face a historic challenge, needing to surpass the highest-ever fourth-innings chase at The Oval, a record set in 1902.

title: Teen girl with 75% burns dies in Delhi; Odisha CM expresses shock
content: A 15-year-old girl from Odisha, who suffered severe burns after being set on fire by unidentified individuals on June 19, has tragically passed away despite intensive medical care at AIIMS New Delhi. The victim, who sustained over 75% burn injuries, was initially treated in Bhubaneswar before being transferred to Delhi.

title: 'Must remain alert': PM Modi's 'Swadeshi' appeal for Indians; days after Trump's 25% tariff
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called for a renewed focus on 'Swadeshi' amid global economic instability. Speaking in Varanasi, he urged Indians to prioritise locally-made products, emphasising the need for national unity and economic self-reliance. Modi cautioned against inward-looking trade policies of other nations and stressed India's commitment to becoming the world's third-largest economy.

title: Shubman Gill, KL Rahul, Ravindra Jadeja create historic feat in England
content: In a historic moment for Indian Test cricket, Shubman Gill, KL Rahul, and Ravindra Jadeja have each surpassed 500 runs in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series. Shubman Gill leads with 754 runs. KL Rahul has contributed 532 runs. Ravindra Jadeja has reached 515 runs. Their combined efforts highlight India's batting prowess and adaptability throughout the series.

title: 'No oil reserves in Pak': Baloch leader says Trump 'gravely misled' by Asim Munir
content: Baloch leader Mir Yar Baloch cautioned Donald Trump in an open letter, asserting that General Asim Munir misled him regarding Balochistan's resource ownership. He clarified that the oil, gas, and mineral reserves Trump mentioned belong to the 'Republic of Balochistan,' not Pakistan. Balochistan opposes any exploitation of its resources without the Baloch people's consent, emphasizing their sovereignty.

title: Pakistan earthquake: 5.4 magnitude tremor jolts several areas; no damage reported
content: A 5.4 magnitude earthquake jolted Pakistan early Saturday, triggering widespread panic across Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Punjab, and Islamabad. The epicentre was traced to Afghanistan's Hindukush region at a depth of 102 kilometres. Tremors were felt in various Afghan and Tajik regions. While no casualties or property damage were reported, residents rushed outdoors reciting Quranic verses.

title: Just 54 runs! Gill's record-breaking series tarnished only by London low
content: Shubman Gill had a remarkable Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series. He scored 754 runs, averaging 83.78. Gill hit four centuries, equaling records. He surpassed Gavaskar's record for most runs as an Indian captain in a series. However, Gill faced challenges in London. His scores at Lord's and The Oval were significantly lower than elsewhere. Despite this, Gill's overall performance cemented his legacy.

title: National Sister‚Äôs Day 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes to share
content: National Sisters' Day, celebrated on August 3rd, 2025, is a special occasion to honor the unique bond shared between sisters. The day encourages acknowledging the unwavering support, shared memories, and deep connection that defines sisterhood. It offers an opportunity to express appreciation through heartfelt messages, thoughtful gestures, and quality time, reinforcing the invaluable role sisters play in each other's lives.

title: 'Sometimes distance teaches you' ‚Äì Saina‚Äôs latest post hints at fresh start with Kashyap
content: Just weeks after announcing their separation, Olympic medalist Saina Nehwal and her husband Parupalli Kashyap have hinted at a reconciliation. Nehwal's recent Instagram post, featuring the couple with a scenic backdrop, suggests they are giving their relationship another chance.

title: FWICE demands Kartik Aaryan to withdraw from an event organised by a Pakistani entity in Houston
content: Kartik Aaryan faces scrutiny as the Federation of Western India Cine Employees (FWICE) cautions him against attending an event in Houston organized by a Pakistani-owned entity, Aga‚Äôs Restaurant and Catering. The event, 'Azadi Utsav ‚Äì The Indian Independence Day,' scheduled for August 15, 2025, raises concerns about associating with Pakistani interests, prompting FWICE to urge Aaryan's withdrawal and seek clarification.

title: IND vs ENG: Ravindra Jadeja creates history, becomes first Indian to score ...
content: Ravindra Jadeja etched his name in history, becoming the first Indian to score 500+ runs in a Test series at No.6 or lower, surpassing VVS Laxman's record. His crucial innings at The Oval, along with Yashasvi Jaiswal's century and Akash Deep's resilient knock, propelled India to a commanding lead against England.

title: She's pink, has scuffs on face & eats popcorn chicken: Labubu doll goes missing in US
content: A San Francisco woman's tipsy night out led to the disappearance of her beloved pink Labubu doll, "Lychee Berry," sparking a city-wide search. The missing poster, featuring Lychee Berry's adventures, went viral, prompting both sympathy and gentle teasing online. Despite the irreplaceable nature of the original, a fellow Labubu enthusiast gifted her a near-identical doll, offering solace and new adventures.

title: 'Was tortured to name PM Modi, Yogi & Bhagwat': Pragya Thakur's big claim in Malegaon blast case
content: Sadhvi Pragya states coercion in naming leaders. A special NIA court acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case. The blast resulted in six deaths and numerous injuries. The court cited lack of evidence against Pragya Thakur. Investigations initially pointed to "saffron extremists". The case saw twists, including allegations against the NIA.

title: First in Test History! Yashasvi Jaiswal's ton powers India to historic milestone
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's century in the fifth Test against England propelled India to a historic milestone, equaling the record for most hundreds scored by a team in a single Test series. India's dominant batting performance, led by Shubman Gill's record-breaking run tally, saw five batters surpass 400 runs, solidifying their command in the series.

title: Avocados have best fats for your body: Here's all you need to know about this superfruit
content: Avocados contain healthy fats, good for the heart. These fats include monounsaturated and polyunsaturated types. Oleic acid helps manage cholesterol levels. Avocados also provide omega-3 and omega-6. Saturated fat content is minimal and balanced. These fats aid vitamin absorption. Avocados promote fullness and support overall well-being. They are a nutritious addition to various diets.

title: ‚ÄòBid to implicate Hindutva leaders': Shinde backs Pragya in Malegaon blast; slams Rahul
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Eknath Shinde defended Pragya Thakur's claims of torture during the Malegaon blast probe, accusing the UPA government of framing Hindutva leaders and coining the term 'saffron terrorism'. Shinde supported Thakur's allegation that she was pressured to implicate PM Modi, criticizing Rahul Gandhi for allegedly echoing Pakistani sentiments.

title: 'If irresponsibility has a face': Sitharaman slams Rahul, calls Jaitley remark 'despicable'
content: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman has strongly condemned Rahul Gandhi's remarks about the late Arun Jaitley, deeming them irresponsible and harmful to the Congress party. Gandhi claimed Jaitley threatened him regarding opposition to farm laws, a claim refuted by Jaitley's son, Rohan, who pointed out his father's death preceded the laws' introduction.

title: Kab Banoge Crorepati? In how many years can you get Rs 1 cr with Rs 25K monthly investment - explained
content: Achieving a ‚Çπ1 crore corpus requires disciplined investing, with the timeline varying based on the chosen investment avenue. While bank deposits offer safety but take over 20 years, equity funds can potentially reach the goal in just 12 years, albeit with higher risk.

title: Tejashwi targets EC with 'EPIC' barb over 'missing name'; poll panel, BJP hit back
content: Tejashwi Yadav ignited a political controversy by alleging his name was missing from Bihar's voter list, accusing the Election Commission of a conspiracy to manipulate voter rolls. He questioned the deletion of 65 lakh names and demanded transparency from the EC.

title: IND vs ENG : Shubman Gill creates history; breaks Sunil Gavaskar record
content: Shubman Gill's impressive stint as India's Test captain concluded at The Oval, marked by a standing ovation despite his dismissal for 11. He amassed 754 runs in the series, the second-highest by an Indian batter, only behind Sunil Gavaskar. Gill also became the second captain after Don Bradman to score 750+ runs in their debut series as Test captain.

title: Pakistan: Shell blast kills 5 children, injures 12; sparks panic among residents
content: A devastating incident in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province resulted in the deaths of five children and injuries to twelve others when an old mortar shell exploded. The children discovered the unexploded shell in nearby hills and unknowingly brought it to their village, where it detonated while they were playing with it.

title: IND vs ENG: Jaiswal, Crawley and Pope caught in fiery exchange - Watch
content: India dominated the morning session on Day 3 at The Oval, reaching 189 for 3 at lunch, fueled by Akash Deep's surprising 66 and Jaiswal's unbeaten 85. Tensions rose as Crawley and Pope confronted Jaiswal, seemingly frustrated by his perceived time-wasting. With a lead exceeding 100 and a flat pitch, India aims to capitalize on England's bowling shortage.

content: the busiest 60 days of the annual recruiting calendar are officially behind us . 155 prospects in the 2026 ESPN 300 made commitments in an avalanche of summer recruiting business from June 1 to July 31 . only 16 uncommitteds remain in the ESPN 300 as of Saturday morning .

title: US escalates war on marriage fraud in green card applications, updates its policy manual
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities.
